required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Effect of AN-PEP Enzyme on Gluten Digestion
clinical_study.official_title: Effect of AN-PEP Enzyme on Gastrointestinal Breakdown of Gluten

brief_summary.textblock: The aim is to demonstrate how fast and to what extent AN-PEP can degrade gluten in vivo in the stomach and how much gluten enters the small intestine. A second question is whether the caloric density of a meal can influence the efficacy of AN-PEP breakdown.

detailed_description.textblock: In this trial, the effect of AN-PEP enzyme on gastrointestinal breakdown of gluten will be investigated in healthy subjects. In addition, it will be assessed if meal calories can affect the efficacy of AN-PEP. Subjects receive intragastrically, either AN-PEP or placebo, with either a high or a low caloric meal in a double-blind, randomized, placebo-controlled, cross-over fashion. Gastrointestinal fluid will be sampled to measure breakdown of gluten.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.measure: Effect of AN-PEP with a low or high caloric meal on gluten degradation in the duodenum
primary_outcome.description: Difference in gluten (volume x concentration) x time between AN-PEP and placebo with a low or high caloric meal in the duodenum

secondary_outcome.measure: Effect of AN-PEP with a low or high caloric meal on gluten degradation in the stomach
secondary_outcome.description: Difference in gluten concentration x time between AN-PEP and placebo with a low or high caloric meal in the stomach

secondary_outcome.measure: Effect of meal caloric density on gastric emptying
secondary_outcome.description: Difference in gastric half emptying time by 13CO2:12CO2 in breath between the high and low caloric meals

secondary_outcome.measure: Effect of AN-PEP and meal caloric density on gastric and duodenal pH
secondary_outcome.description: Change in gastric and duodenal pH over time

secondary_outcome.measure: Effect of caloric density on AN-PEP-mediated gluten degradation in the duodenum
secondary_outcome.description: Difference in gluten (concentration) x time between AN-PEP with a high vs low caloric meal in the duodenum

secondary_outcome.measure: Effect of caloric density on AN-PEP-mediated gluten degradation in the stomach
secondary_outcome.description: Difference in gluten concentration x time between AN-PEP with a high vs low caloric meal in the stomach

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Male/female
- Age â‰¥ 18 years but < 45 years
- Hormonal contraceptive treatment
- Subject has read and understood the information provided on the study and given written informed consent
Exclusion Criteria:
- Any medical condition or laboratory test result that in the opinion of the investigators may interfere with the study and may jeopardise the health status of the participant
- pregnancy or lactation
- women not treated with hormonal contraceptive treatment
